column4: im trying to install ubuntu 10.4 but i want my root fs to be btrfs. can anyone here help me?
so the partitioner will format btrfs if i do custom?
if its an option, yes. You can always install an extra package or option to get the filesystem
i added the btrfs tools thru synaptic & gparted still doesn't have that fs
remove old kernels is a great way to free space
also remove apps you don't use, also run: sudo apt-get clean
or apps i dont use its almost a fresh install

also install bleachbit, close as many apps as you can and run it as user and root to clean files (watch options for browser or it'll cleat settings you want as avoid options which say they will take a long time
also you can remove openoffice and install abiword if you only need a word processor
probably temp stuff, bleachbit will sort that, also your emails may use a lot with attachments
like ~/.mozilla if you use firefox will have all the temp internet files
isnt there some way to get like the last 5kb of the file to open in gedit without opening the whole thing?
